Package me.philcali.device.pool

Interface DevicePool

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseDevicePool, LocalDevicePool
    public interface DevicePool
extends AutoCloseable
    The client side abstraction for creating programmatic Devices to interact with. Implementations of the DevicePool primarily consist of control plane functions to obtain Devices.
    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    philcali

    • Method Detail

      • provision

        ProvisionOutput provision​(ProvisionInput input)
                   throws ProvisioningException
        Creates a provision request for this DevicePool implementation. It is important to know that the provisioning process is asynchronous. Some implementations may be able to fulfill the request immediately, and some may inform systems to acquire the necessary resources. This method is considered the entrypoint of the provisioning workflow.
        Parameters:
        input - Provision request to this pool in the form of a ProvisionInput
        Returns:
        The result of the provision request in the form of a ProvisionOutput
        Throws:
        ProvisioningException - Failure to fulfill the provision request

      • describe

        ProvisionOutput describe​(ProvisionOutput output)
                  throws ProvisioningException
        Describes the provisioning state of a ProvisionInput.
        Parameters:
        output - A partial or complete ProvisionOutput from a provision request
        Returns:
        The result of the provision request in the form of a ProvisionOutput
        Throws:
        ProvisioningException - Failure of describe the provision resource

      • obtain

        List<Device> obtain​(ProvisionOutput output)
             throws ProvisioningException
        Attempts to provide a collection of Device attached to a provision request.
        Parameters:
        output - The state of a provision in the form of a ProvisionOutput
        Returns:
        A List of Device entries
        Throws:
        ProvisioningException - Failure to obtain Devices for this provision

      • create

        static DevicePool create​(DevicePoolConfig config)

      • create

        @Deprecated(forRemoval=true,
            since="1.2.0")
static DevicePool create​(InputStream inputStream)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Attempts to create a DevicePool from an input stream, pointing at a properties file. An application might provide a devices/pool.properties file on the classpath. The contents of the file for building a valid BaseDevicePool might look like: 
         device.pool.class=me.philcali.device.pool.BaseDevicePool
 device.pool.provision=me.philcali.device.pool.provision.LocalProvisionService
 device.pool.provision.local.hosts.host1.address=myhost.example.com
 device.pool.provision.local.hosts.host1.platform=unix:armv7
 device.pool.connection=me.philcali.device.pool.ssh.ConnectionFactorySSH
 device.pool.connection.ssh.user=ec2-user

        Then the following code would work: 
             DevicePool pool = DevicePool.create();
     List<Device> devices = pool.provisionSync(ProvisionInput.create(), 5, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
        Parameters:
        inputStream -
        Returns:

      • create

        static DevicePool create​(ClassLoader loader)

      • create

        static DevicePool create()

      • provisionAsync

        default CompletableFuture<List<Device>> provisionAsync​(ProvisionInput input)
        Convenience method for wrapping client side provision workflow in an async future. The future will loop forever, but can be bounded by client control. Note: 
         var future = devicePool.provisionAsync(ProvisionInput.create());
 try {
     var devices = future.get(5. TimeUnit.MINUTES);
 } catch (TimeoutException | ExecutionException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }
        Parameters:
        input - the ProvisionInput request
        Returns:
        a CompletableFuture of Devices

      • provisionSync

        default List<Device> provisionSync​(ProvisionInput input,
                                   long amount,
                                   TimeUnit unit)
                            throws ProvisioningException
        Convenience method to block on any provision request. This method handles the polling of a provision request. Example: 
             ProvisionInput input = ProvisionInput.builder().amount(5).build();
     List<Device> devices = devicePool.provisionSync(input, 30, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
        Parameters:
        input - The provision request in the form of a ProvisionInput
        amount - The amount of TimeUnit in unit
        unit - The TimeUnit to simplify timeout
        Returns:
        a List of Device objects
        Throws:
        ProvisioningException - Failure to provision devices in the time allotted among other reasons

      • close

        default void close()
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
